intro: Tiquilia darwinii, commonly known as Darwin's tiquilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It belongs to the Loasaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, hairy stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils, and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its flowers are usually pale green to yellowish in color, and it produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. Tiquilia darwinii is often found in desert scrub and creosote bush communities.
